content:
I understand what you mean about the third season of "Stranger Things". While it still had some great moments, it didn't quite live up to the standards set by the first two seasons. The finale was definitely a highlight, though! That final battle was intense, and the aftermath was emotional. I'm curious to see where the show goes from here.

As for "The Witcher", I agree that Henry Cavill's acting can be a bit stiff at times. However, I think he's still a great fit for the role of Geralt, and he brings a certain level of gravitas to the character. The world-building and action scenes are indeed some of the show's strongest aspects. The Continent is so richly detailed, and the fight choreography is top-notch.

It's interesting that you mention Cavill's acting, because I think it's a common criticism of the show. However, I've also seen some fans defend him, saying that his stoic, brooding performance is actually fitting for the character of Geralt. What do you think? Do you think Cavill's acting style works for the role, or would you like to see a bit more emotion from him?

Also, what do you think about the supporting cast? Any favorite characters or storylines? I personally love Jaskier's wit and charm, and I think Joey Batey does a great job bringing the character to life.
